Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to represent an artificial neural network (ANN), currently being used to classify images from the MNIST dataset in conjunction with the ImageInterpreter class.
    Author:
    rsyed0
    See Also:
    SigmoidNeuron, MnistImageInterpreter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Network()
      A constructor to create an empty artificial neural network (ANN).
      Network(int[] sizes, java.lang.String fileName)
      A constructor to create an artificial neural network (ANN) with the given sizes for each layer, and save the network and its parameters as a text file with the given file name.
      Network(java.lang.Integer... sizes)
      A constructor to create an artificial neural network (ANN) with the given sizes for each layer.
      Network(java.util.List<SigmoidNeuron> neurons)
      A constructor to create an artificial neural network (ANN) with the given neurons for each layer, and save the network and its parameters as a text file with the given file name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Network

        public Network()
        A constructor to create an empty artificial neural network (ANN).
        Since:
        1.0

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer... sizes)
        A constructor to create an artificial neural network (ANN) with the given sizes for each layer. The weights and biases for each connection/neuron are initially randomized, and thus, the network must be trained to perform any tasks.
        Parameters:
        sizes - The sizes of each layer.
        Since:
        1.0

      • Network

        public Network(int[] sizes,
               java.lang.String fileName)
        A constructor to create an artificial neural network (ANN) with the given sizes for each layer, and save the network and its parameters as a text file with the given file name. The weights and biases for each connection/neuron are initially randomized, and thus, the network must be trained to perform any tasks.
        Parameters:
        sizes - The sizes of each layer as an integer array.
        fileName - The name of the file to be written to when saving.
        Since:
        1.0

      • Network

        public Network(java.util.List<SigmoidNeuron> neurons)
        A constructor to create an artificial neural network (ANN) with the given neurons for each layer, and save the network and its parameters as a text file with the given file name. The weights and biases for each connection/neuron are initially randomized, and thus, the network must be trained to perform any tasks.
        Parameters:
        neurons - A list of sigmoid neurons containing each neuron in the network.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        loadNetworkFromResource, SigmoidNeuron

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public java.util.List<double[]> run(double[] inputs)
        Takes an array of floating point values as inputs for the ANN, and returns an array of floating point values representing the outputs of each layer of the ANN.
        Parameters:
        inputs - A double array giving the inputs to the first layer of the network.
        Returns:
        The output from each layer of the network as a list of double arrays.
        Since:
        1.0

      • convertToBrightness

        public static java.util.List<double[]> convertToBrightness(java.lang.String imagesName,
                                                           java.lang.String labelsName,
                                                           int start,
                                                           int end,
                                                           boolean bw)
        A method that takes a set of MNIST images from the starting index at the given address up to, but discluding, the ending index, and converts them into double arrays based on their brightnesses. A value of 1.0 indicates full darkness, while a value of 0.0 indicates complete light. These double arrays are then compiled into a list, and returned.
        Parameters:
        imagesName - The address of the images being loaded.
        labelsName - The address of the labels for the images being loaded.
        start - The starting index of the image to be converted into a brightness array.
        end - The ending index of the image to be converted into a brightness array.
        bw - A boolean specifying if grays should be converted to blacks.
        Returns:
        A double array listing every pixel's brightness, listed row by row.

      • trainFromMnistData

        public void trainFromMnistData(java.lang.String imagesName,
                               java.lang.String labelsName,
                               double eta,
                               int start,
                               int end,
                               int epochs,
                               boolean bw)
        Trains the ANN using data at the given location, which must be in the form given in the MNIST dataset. Uses the MnistDataReader class to transform the MNIST data into the form of instances of the MnistMatrix class. This method implements the stochastic gradient descent (SGD) algorithm with backpropagation to edit weights and biases such that the network can classify images with a lower percentage of error.
        Parameters:
        imagesName - A string giving the address of the training images.
        labelsName - A string giving the address of the training labels.
        eta - The rate at which the network should learn; the learning rate.
        start - The starting index of the MNIST images that should be shown to the network.
        end - The ending index of the MNIST images that should be shown to the network.
        epochs - The number of times that the set of images should be shown.
        bw - A boolean specifying whether or not grays should be reflected as black.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        MnistDataReader, MnistMatrix

      • train

        public void train(double[] brightness,
                  int label,
                  double eta)
        A method that trains the network using backpropagation given a set of inputs and the correct output. It trains the network "at" the given rate.
        Parameters:
        brightness - The input to the network.
        label - The correct output from the network.
        eta - The rate at which the network should learn; the learning rate.
        Since:
        1.2

      • testAll

        public void testAll(java.lang.String imagesName,
                    java.lang.String labelsName,
                    int start,
                    int end,
                    boolean showMistakes,
                    boolean bw)
        A method that tests the neural network with MNIST training data. The network must have an output layer of size 10 and input layer of size 784.
        Parameters:
        imagesName - The address at which the MNIST testing images can be found.
        labelsName - The address at which the MNIST testing labels can be found.
        start - The starting index of the training images to be "shown" to the network.
        end - The starting index of the training images to be "shown" to the network.
        showMistakes - A boolean indicating whether or not to render all MNIST images where the network made a mistake.
        bw - A boolean specifying whether or not grays should be reflected as blacks.
        Since:
        1.0

      • saveNetworkAtResource

        public void saveNetworkAtResource(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves a network description at the given file resource address.
        Parameters:
        fileName - A string giving the address of the file resource that the network is to be saved to.
        Since:
        1.0

      • loadNetworkFromResource

        public static Network loadNetworkFromResource(java.lang.String fileName)
                                       throws NetworkNotFoundException
        Loads a saved network from a given file name pointing to a text file resource. Returns the network obtained from analyzing the text file. Throws a NetworkNot FoundException if there is no network at the specified resource.
        Parameters:
        fileName - A string giving the address of the file resource to be loaded.
        Returns:
        An object of the Network class representing the network from the loaded resource.
        Throws:
        NetworkNotFoundException
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        SigmoidNeuron, NetworkNotFoundException

      • train

        public void train(double[] input,
                  double[] expOutput,
                  double eta)
        A generalized method for training a network given a set of input values and the expected, or ideal, set of output values using the backpropagation algorithm.
        Parameters:
        input - The input values to the network.
        expOutput - The expected output values from the network.
        eta - The rate at which the network should learn.

      • loadNetworkFromResource

        public static Network loadNetworkFromResource(java.util.List<java.lang.String> file,
                                              java.lang.String fileName)
                                       throws NetworkNotFoundException
        A method that loads a network from a List of Strings.
        Parameters:
        file - The file as a List of Strings.
        fileName - The name of the file, to be mentioned in the case of malfunction.
        Returns:
        Network stored at the given file.
        Throws:
        NetworkNotFoundException

      • sizes

        public int[] sizes()
        A method that returns the sizes of each layer in the network in the form of an integer array.
        Returns:
        An integer array giving the sizes of each layer in the network.

        public java.util.List<SigmoidNeuron[]> getNetwork()
